III.ii.2.A.1.b
.
Definition:
STRs
Service treatment records
(STRs) are the chronological records (electronic or paper) documenting the medical and/or dental care and treatment received primarily outside of a hospital (i.e - outpatient) during service.  The records may contain a synopsis of any inpatient hospital care and/or mental health treatment related to the service members' service.  (For many years, they were referred to as service medical records (SMRs)).
Original, paper versions of STRs in the Department of Veterans Affairs’ (VA’s) possession belong to the Department of Defense (DoD) and are only on loan to VA.  They are subject to recall by entities within DoD, to include Reserve and National Guard units.
Note
:  STRs are typically recalled when a Veteran
returns to active duty, or
begins actively serving in a Reserve or National Guard unit.
Reference
:  For more information on handling requests for the return of original STRs, see
M21-1, Part II, Subpart ii, 2.B.5.a
.
title: M21-1, Part III, Subpart ii, Chapter 2, Section A - General Information on Service Records
citation: Part III, Subpart ii, Chapter 2, Section A
